perturbation.original_text: Athens Bancshares Corporation, a Tennessee corporation (the "Company"), and Athens Federal Community Bank, a federal savings bank located  in Athens, Tennessee (the "Bank") (references to the "Bank" include the Bank in mutual or stock form as indicated by the context), the deposit  accounts of which are insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation ("FDIC"), hereby confirm their agreement with Keefe, Bruyette &  Woods, Inc. (the "Agent") as follows:
perturbation.changed_text: Athens Bancshares Corporation, a Tennessee corporation (the "Organization"), and Athens Federal Community Bank, a federal savings bank located  in Athens, Tennessee (the "Financial Institution") (references to the "Bank" include the Bank in mutual or stock form as indicated by the context), the deposit  accounts of which are insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation ("FDIC"), hereby confirm their agreement with Keefe, Bruyette &  Woods, Inc. (the "Agent") as follows:
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Company' and 'Bank' are replaced by 'Organization' and 'Financial Institution', making it unclear which entity the contract refers to throughout the document.

perturbation.original_text: Section 2. Retention and Compensation of Agent. Subject to the terms and conditions herein set forth, the Company and the Bank hereby appoint  the Agent as their exclusive financial advisor and marketing agent (i) to utilize its best efforts to solicit subscriptions for Common Shares and to  advise and assist the Company and the Bank with respect to the Company's sale of the Shares in the Offering and (ii) to participate in the Offering  in the areas of market making and in syndicate formation (if necessary).
perturbation.changed_text: Section 2. Retention and Compensation of Agent. Subject to the terms and conditions herein set forth, the Organization and the Financial Institution hereby appoint  the Agent as their exclusive financial advisor and marketing agent (i) to utilize its best efforts to solicit subscriptions for Common Shares and to  advise and assist the Company and the Bank with respect to the Company's sale of the Shares in the Offering and (ii) to participate in the Offering  in the areas of market making and in syndicate formation (if necessary).
perturbation.explanation: Using a mix of 'Company', 'Bank', 'Organization', and 'Financial Institution' in the same paragraph causes confusion as to which entity is responsible for which obligations.

perturbation.original_text: The obligations of the Agent pursuant to this Agreement shall terminate upon termination of the Offering, but in no event later than 45 days after  the completion of the Subscription Offering (the "End Date"). All fees or expenses due to the Agent but unpaid will be payable to the Agent in  next day funds at the earlier of the Closing Date (as hereinafter defined) or the End Date. In the event the Offering is extended beyond the End  Date, the Company and the Agent may agree to renew this Agreement under mutually acceptable terms.
perturbation.changed_text: The obligations of the Agent pursuant to this Agreement shall terminate upon termination of the Offering, but in no event later than 45 days after  the completion of the Subscription Offering (the "Termination Date"). All fees or expenses due to the Agent but unpaid will be payable to the Agent in  next day funds at the earlier of the Closing Date (as hereinafter defined) or the End Date. In the event the Offering is extended beyond the End  Date, the Organization and the Agent may agree to renew this Agreement under mutually acceptable terms.
perturbation.explanation: Conflicting terms 'End Date' and 'Termination Date' are defined for the same concept, creating uncertainty regarding when the contract terminates. The use of 'Organization' instead of Company further complicates the understanding.
